channel.title: Morning Mail
channel.description: Stay updated on the latest news and events happening in the RPI community.

item.title: RPI Builds Bridges to the Future During Bicentennial Commencement Weekend
item.description: From building the Brooklyn Bridge to sending humans to the moon, much has changed in the world since Rensselaer was founded 200 years ago in 1824. RPI honored its two centuries of driving technological progress during its Bicentennial Commencement Weekend, with the celebration featuring astronaut and Artemis II Commander Reid Wiseman as Commencement speaker and Emily Warren Roebling, who was instrumental in the construction of the Brooklyn Bridge, receiving a posthumous honorary degree.
item.author: Community

item.title: Collegiate Store Announces End-of-Season Clearance Sale
item.description: The Rensselaer Collegiate Store continues its Markdown Madness with its end-of-season clearance sale! Through the end of May, select clothing and gift items are up to 50% off so the Store’s staff can clear space for new items and styles this Fall. The sale is available in-store or online; some exclusions apply.
item.author: Community

item.title: Theo Jean Cuthand Bringing “Indigiqueer” Talk, Screening to EMPAC
item.description: Date: Wednesday, May 29, 2024 7:00 PM - In a co-presentation with iEAR Presents and the EMPAC curatorial program, Theo Jean Cuthand — who makes short experimental videos and films about sexuality, madness, Queer identity, love, and Indigeneity — will give a talk and screening that explores his work and process through an Indigiqueer lens. This event is free and open to the public, and no ticket is required.
item.author: Community

item.title: SoS to Host Field Trip to American Museum of Natural History
item.description: Date: Tuesday, June 11, 2024 6:45 AM - 6:45 PM - The School of Science will host an academic field trip to the American Museum of Natural History. This opportunity is open to all Arch students but registration is due by May 27; to sign up, please send email to the School of Science.
item.author: Students

item.title: Appointments Now Available at COMM+D!
item.description: Are you working on a writing assignment, oral presentation, or visual design project? Whether you’re still in the initial brainstorming stages or finishing up your final revisions, the Center for Global Communication+Design can help, so schedule an appointment with a member of COMM+D’s trained staff today!
item.author: Students

item.title: Rotterdam Aquarium Field Trip Scheduled for May 30
item.description:
Date: Thursday, May 30, 2024 9:00 AM - 5:00 PM - The School of Science will host an academic field trip to the Rotterdam Aquarium. This opportunity is open to all Arch students; to sign up, please send email to the School of Science.

For information about sharing your news or events, or to change your subscription settings, visit morningmail.rpi.edu.
item.author: Students
